summary: Completed comprehensive testing of 3 new features: Inventory Management, Date Range Filter on Jobs page, and Technician Metrics. All 28 backend API tests passed (100%). Frontend UI testing confirmed all features working correctly.

issues: Console warning: Missing `Description` or `aria-describedby={undefined}` for {DialogContent} - accessibility improvement recommended

critical_code_review_comments: All new endpoints properly require authentication
Stock adjustment correctly prevents negative quantities
Date range filter properly handles both date_from and date_to parameters
Technician metrics aggregation working correctly with jobs_created, jobs_closed, avg_repair_time

tests: GET /api/inventory/stats - Returns total_items, low_stock_count, out_of_stock, total_cost_value, total_selling_value
POST /api/inventory - Create item with all fields
POST /api/inventory - Auto-generate SKU when not provided
UI: Add Item modal with all fields
UI: Stats cards (Total Items, Low Stock, Out of Stock, Stock Value)
GET /api/jobs?date_from=X&date_to=Y - Filter jobs in date range
GET /api/jobs?date_from=X&status_filter=Y - Combine date and status filters
UI: Calendar popover opens on click
GET /api/metrics/technicians - Returns technicians array with id, name, role, jobs_created, jobs_closed, jobs_by_status, avg_repair_time_hours, avg_repair_time_display
GET /api/metrics/overview - Returns jobs_this_week, jobs_this_month, completed_this_week, avg_jobs_per_day, monthly_revenue, jobs_by_status, trend (7 days)
UI: Technician Performance table with Rank, Name, Role, Jobs Created, Jobs Closed, Avg Repair Time, Status Breakdown

seed_data_creation: Created and deleted test inventory item 'UI Test Screen' during UI testing
context_for_next_testing_agent: 3 new features fully implemented and tested: 1) Inventory Management with CRUD, stock adjustments, stats, filters, search 2) Date Range Filter on Jobs page with calendar popovers 3) Technician Metrics with performance data and overview stats. All backend endpoints require authentication. Frontend pages accessible via sidebar navigation.
